task_summary: Detect the T-shaped block, approach and align the circular end-effector, execute two pushes to seat the block into the T-shaped target outline, verify alignment, settle, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style manipulator with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block into a fixed T-outline on a white tabletop. The sequence begins with perception of the block and the goal outline, then a top-approach and fine alignment to establish a good pushing contact. The tool orientation is set for lateral pushing. Two controlled pushes translate and nudge the block into the target outline. The robot verifies final pose relative to the outline, briefly waits to dissipate motion, and retreats. Visual cues dominate; both observation and control operate at 10 Hz.
preconditions: Workspace clear except for the T-shaped block and goal outline
Camera provides sufficient view of block and outline
Friction adequate for pushing without slipping
stepwise_plan: Detect block and detect target outline.
Move above the block; approach and align for a stable pushing contact.
Set end-effector yaw suitable for lateral pushing.
Push the block toward the outline (primary translation).
Apply a short orthogonal push to fine-seat the block.
Re-align against the outline and check goal pose.
success_criteria: Block lies within the T-shaped outline with small pose error
No unintended rotation or overshoot after settling
Robot safely retreats with no contact
failure_and_recovery: Perception miss: re-run detection or expand search area
Insufficient contact: re-approach and realign before pushing
Overshoot or misalignment: apply corrective, shorter push
Object slip: reduce push distance on retry
task_long_description.termination: Task ends when the block is verified at the target outline, settling wait completes, and the robot retreats.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Vision detection of the T-shaped target area.
Move above the block with a small vertical clearance.
Close in and align for a stable pushing contact.
Set tool yaw for lateral pushing.
Orthogonal nudge to seat the block.
Final alignment relative to the outline.
Check if block/tool is at the target region.

failure_modes: Block not detected due to glare/occlusion
Tool contacts at poor angle causing rotation
recovery_strategy: Repeat detection or widen search region
Apply shorter corrective push in opposite/orthogonal direction
Pause and re-seat with small nudges
assumptions: Frames show a red T-block and blue outline rather than gray/green; metadata keeps instruction wording but follows frames.
Tool is circular and planar-contact pushing is safe; no grasp required.
10 Hz frequencies noted but not directly parameterized in ports.

expected_success_criteria: Block pose within small tolerance of the T-outline after settling
